repos.snippetIntro: This is the documentation for FOLIO apps. If working with this Hugo site locally, be sure to execute

repos.name: edge-api-utils
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this edge API utils is the combine classes/utilities/constants shared by both modules: edge-common and edge-common-spring.

repos.description: Bridge the gap between CaiaSoft remote storage provider and FOLIO
repos.name: edge-caiasoft
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this edge API is to bridge the gap between CaiaSoft remote storage provider and FOLIO.

repos.description: a shared library/framework for edge APIs
repos.name: edge-common
repos.snippetIntro: Common/Shared library for Edge APIs.

repos.description: A shared library/framework for edge APIs for spring way modules
repos.name: edge-common-spring
repos.snippetIntro: This is a shared library/framework for edge APIs for spring way modules. This module is a port of edge-common, and main goal is feature parity with that framework. From a hosting/SysOps perspective, edge modules developed with this framework should be indistinguishable from those developed using edge-common.

repos.description: Integrate a direct single record import via OCLC Connexion
repos.name: edge-connexion
repos.snippetIntro: edge-connexion is a FOLIO module for importing records to a FOLIO instance via OCLC Connexion

repos.description: Edge API is to bridge the gap between 3rd party discovery services and FOLIO mod-courses module.
repos.name: edge-courses
repos.snippetIntro: Provides an ability to retrieve course-reserve information from FOLIO

repos.name: edge-dcb
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this edge API is to bridge the gap between DCB provider and FOLIO.

repos.description: Bridge the gap between Dematic remote storage provider and FOLIO
repos.name: edge-dematic
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this edge API is to bridge the gap between Dematic remote storage provider and FOLIO.

repos.name: edge-erm
repos.snippetIntro: Provides an ability to retrieve license term information from FOLIO to external systems. The data flow is edge-erm <-> FOLIO <-> mod-agreements.

repos.name: edge-fqm
repos.snippetIntro: Provides an ability to retrieve query and entity type information from FOLIO

repos.description: A Spring based shared library/framework for edge APIs to INN-REACH system.
repos.name: edge-inn-reach
repos.snippetIntro: A Spring based shared library/framework for edge APIs to INN-REACH system.

repos.name: edge-inventory
repos.snippetIntro: Provides an ability to retrieve inventory information from FOLIO

repos.name: edge-lti-courses
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this edge module is to connect LMS such as Sakai and Blackboard (LTI Platforms) to Folio via the LTI Advantage protocol for the purposes of sharing the course reserves stored in Folio.

repos.description: Edge API for mod-ncip
repos.name: edge-ncip
repos.snippetIntro: Edge API for mod-ncip

repos.description: Edge API for Metadata Harvesting
repos.name: edge-oai-pmh
repos.snippetIntro: Edge API for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH Version 2.0)

repos.name: edge-orders
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this edge API is to bridge the gap between 3rd party purchasing systems/vendors and FOLIO. More specifically, the initial implementation was built with EBSCO's GOBI (Global Online Bibliographic Interface) service in mind.

repos.name: edge-patron
repos.snippetIntro: Edge API to interface with FOLIO for 3rd party discovery services to allow patrons to perform self-service actions (place holds, renewals, etc)

repos.description: Edge API for RTAC (RealTime Availability Check)
repos.name: edge-rtac
repos.snippetIntro: Edge API to interface with FOLIO for 3rd party discovery services to determine holdings availability.

repos.description: 3M Standard Interchange Protocol (SIP) support in FOLIO
repos.name: edge-sip2
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this edge API is to bridge the gap between self service circulation and patron services stations and FOLIO by allowing these systems to issue requests and receive responses in Standard Interchange Protocol v2 (SIP2). These requests will be serviced by FOLIO APIs and the responses will be based on FOLIO results for all supported (TBD) SIP2 commands.

repos.name: edge-users
repos.snippetIntro: Provides an ability to retrieve and create users information from FOLIO

At present most of the content here consists of SQL reports developed by the FOLIO reporting community and based on the requirements of FOLIO partner libraries. In addition to report development, FOLIO has a Reporting Special Interest Group that discusses reporting requirements and other related topics.

repos.name: folio-flow-engine
repos.snippetIntro: This is a simple flow engine that can be used to execute a series of tasks in a specific order. The tasks are executed in a separate thread. The tasks are executed in the order they are added to the flow. The flow can be executed multiple times. The flow can be executed in parallel or in sequence.

repos.description: Helm charts modules repository (using Helm common library)
repos.name: folio-helm-v2
repos.snippetIntro: This repository contains Helm charts for different modules of the FOLIO (The Future of Libraries is Open) project. The FOLIO project aims to reimagine library software through a unique collaboration of libraries, developers, and vendors. It looks beyond the current model of an Integrated Library System to a new paradigm, where apps are built on an open platform, providing libraries with the ability to innovate and deliver extended services.

repos.name: mgr-tenants
repos.snippetIntro: For now, mgr-tenants proxies requests to OKAPI's tenant API When any operation will happen on tenant, it will take place on realm in keycloak, also it will send a request to keycloak to retrieve a token and persist in cache for 60s for doing all the stuff related to realm

repos.description: A FOLIO Module for handling the server side work needed for the ERM system
repos.name: mod-agreements
repos.snippetIntro: Mod-Agreements is a FOLIO module to manage agreements which control an institutions access to resources. Normally, this will be subscribed access to packages of electronic resources, although the aim is to make the affordances offered by mod-agreements as general as possible.

repos.description: Module for managing audit data
repos.name: mod-audit
repos.snippetIntro: The mod-audit module provides API to access and modify audit data.

repos.description: Module for filtering requests based on JWT tokens
repos.name: mod-authtoken
repos.snippetIntro: This module is responsible for filtering all proxy traffic and checking for a valid token. In addition, it is responsible for retrieving the permissions for a given user and making decisions regarding access based on user permissions and defined requirements for a given path. It provides a token creation endpoint that privileged modules (such as Authentication) may make use of.

repos.description: Batch printing service
repos.name: mod-batch-print
repos.snippetIntro: mod-batch-print is a service to provide option to print notices in daily batch approach.

repos.name: mod-bulk-operations

repos.description: Calendar functionalities to enable service points to maintain hours of operation

It's purpose is to provide a bounded context for the storage, retrieval and update of directory service information which underpins inter-library services. This directory contains, but is not restricted to

repos.snippetIntro: mod-eusage-reports is a backend module for parsing and storing relationships between COUNTER report lines and KB items, and for storing access statistics (access numbers and cost) for specific periods.

repos.description: Provides functionality for the notification events
repos.name: mod-event-config
repos.snippetIntro: The module provides information describing the notification events. The event configuration describes the event name, delivery channels, and contain references to templates for each delivery channel.

repos.description: Provide central management for fees and fines
repos.name: mod-feesfines
repos.snippetIntro: Module to provide central feesfines management for FOLIO systems.

repos.name: mod-finance-storage
repos.snippetIntro: This RMB-module is responsible for the persistence of finance-related data (i.e. funds, ledgers, transactions, etc.)

repos.description: FOLIO Query Machine back-end module
repos.name: mod-fqm-manager
repos.snippetIntro: FQM (FOLIO query machine) is the engine that takes in queries, processes queries, and provides answers. FQM consolidates data from different modules within FOLIO in real time, allowing users to conduct cross-application searches efficiently.

repos.name: mod-gobi
repos.snippetIntro: GOBI® (Global Online Bibliographic Information) is the leading web-based acquisitions tool for finding, ordering and managing e-books and print books for libraries. This module allows GOBI initiated orders to be fulfilled by FOLIO.

repos.name: mod-graph-rebuilder
repos.snippetIntro: mod-graph-rebuilder works with mod-linked-date. Further description to be added.

repos.description: FOLIO module for executing GraphQL queries
repos.name: mod-graphql
repos.snippetIntro: mod-graphql is a FOLIO module, written in Node.js, that provides a GraphQL service by HTTP POST to /graphql/. It can be interrogated using any GraphQL client library, such as Apollo, and the graph it provides is auto-generated from the API description files (RAML and JSON Schema) of the modules that it's providing the GraphQL API for.

repos.description: Manage walk-in contracts. Funded by European Regional Development Fund (EFRE).
repos.name: mod-idm-connect
repos.snippetIntro: The module manages walk-in contracts. It is tailored to the specific requirements at Leipzig University Library. You may not find this module useful in different environments.

repos.description: Module to handle username/password login
repos.name: mod-login
repos.snippetIntro: This module is responsible for verifying the user's identity and issuing a valid JWT that can be used for system access. The implementation of this module may vary (username/password, SAML, OAuth, etc.), and it is possible for more than one Authentication module to exist in a running system. The default implementation uses a simple username and password for authentication.

repos.description: Backend Module implementing the OAI-PMH metadata harvesting protocol
repos.name: mod-oai-pmh
repos.snippetIntro: Backend Module implementing the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH Version 2.0), but providing more RESTful API than described in the specification. At the core places the /oai/records endpoint which accepts verb name as main parameter which defines what type of request is and which handler should ve invoked for processing the request.

repos.name: mod-okapi-facade
repos.snippetIntro: Okapi facade partially implements okapi�s interface(s) via interactions w/ manager components.

repos.description: Orders business logic module
repos.name: mod-orders
repos.snippetIntro: This is the Orders business logic module.

repos.description: Storage (CRUD) module for Orders
repos.name: mod-orders-storage
repos.snippetIntro: This is the Orders storage module.

repos.description: Organizations business logic module
repos.name: mod-organizations
repos.snippetIntro: This is the Organizations business logic module.

repos.description: Persistent storage of organizations data
repos.name: mod-organizations-storage
repos.snippetIntro: This is the Organizations storage module.

repos.description: Performs password validation and stores validation rules for specified tenant
repos.name: mod-password-validator
repos.snippetIntro: The module provides a default rule set for a tenant and functionality to manage them via REST API and also allows to use a validation flow for a user password.

repos.name: mod-patron
repos.snippetIntro: Microservice to allow 3rd party discovery services to perform FOLIO patron actions via the discovery service's UI.

repos.description: FOLIO module for automated patron blocks
repos.name: mod-patron-blocks
repos.snippetIntro: FOLIO module for automated patron blocks

repos.description: Module to handle permissions and permissions/user associations
repos.name: mod-permissions
repos.snippetIntro: This module stores permissions and associations between permissions and users. It also maintains a hierarchy of permissions and sub-permissions, allowing for permissions to act as roles, rather than simple bits. It is used primarily by the Authtoken module, though it is possible that some Authentication implementations may have reason to make calls to the Permissions module as well.

repos.description: Publisher-subscriber module to provide event-driven approach
repos.name: mod-pubsub
repos.snippetIntro: The mod-pubsub module is responsible for maintaining the registration of EventTypes and for coordinating distribution of Events to the appropriate Subscribers. Folio modules may publish Events and/or subscribe to Events of specific EventTypes. It is the responsibility of Publisher modules to define the EventTypes that they will provide, which is accomplished through the use of an EventDescriptor. Note that it is possible for multiple Publishers to register for the same EventType. However, the EventType may only be defined once. Subscribing modules will register themselves to specific EvenTypes by providing a URI that will be invoked by the event manager when pushing events of matching EvenTypes. Event subscription is done on a per tenant basis.

repos.description: Backend for quickMARC editor
repos.name: mod-quick-marc
repos.snippetIntro: Spring-based module that provides API for quickMARC - in-app editor for MARC records in SRS.

repos.name: mod-reading-room
repos.snippetIntro: APIs for managing reading room and its related access.

repos.description: Module manages record specifications and validates records against them
repos.name: mod-record-specifications
repos.snippetIntro: mod-record-specifications is a module for managing and validating records against predefined specifications.

repos.description: Backend module for remote storage.
repos.name: mod-remote-storage
repos.snippetIntro: Backend module for remote storages

repos.description: Pluggable data synchronisation with arbitrary sources - initially focussed on LASER resources into Subscriptions and Agreements. Funded by European Regional Development Fund (EFRE)
repos.name: mod-remote-sync

repos.description: Interface to Metadb/LDP reporting databases (plug-compatible reimplementation of mod-ldp)
repos.name: mod-reporting
repos.snippetIntro: mod-reporting is a FOLIO module that mediates access to reporting databases -- instances of either MetaDB or LDP Classic. It removes the need to deal directly with a relational database by providing a simple WSAPI that can be used by UI code such as ui-ldp.

repos.description: Mediated requests back-end module
repos.name: mod-requests-mediated
repos.snippetIntro: FOLIO compatible mediated requests functionality, including secure requests.

repos.description: A service that provides a clustering storage of metadata for Data Integration purposes
repos.name: mod-reservoir
repos.snippetIntro: A service that provides a clustering storage of metadata for Data Integration purposes. Optimized for fast storage and retrieval performance.

repos.name: mod-roles-keycloak
repos.snippetIntro: For now, mod-roles-keycloak proxies requests to Keycloak. Service helps manage roles and policies: creating, updating, deleting and searching. The service can be used to associate roles with the user.mod-roles-keycloak stores metadata about who and when created a record.

repos.description: Module providing Resource Sharing services to an OKAPI environment
repos.name: mod-rs
mod-rtac
repos.snippetIntro: Microservice to allow 3rd party discovery services to determine the availability of FOLIO inventory.

repos.name: mod-scheduler
repos.snippetIntro: mod-scheduler provides following functionality:

repos.name: mod-search
repos.snippetIntro: This module provides a search functionality for instance and authorities via REST API. It uses The Contextual Query Language as a formal language to query records using filters, boolean conditions, etc.

repos.description: Sending messages through delivery channels
repos.name: mod-sender
repos.snippetIntro: Sending messages through delivery channels

repos.description: FOLIO Backend module for Serials Management
repos.name: mod-serials-management
repos.snippetIntro: mod-serials-management is a FOLIO module to support serials management functionality. Specifically this includes managing serial records which support a status and description, can be linked to a purchase order line and title from mod-orders and can have a publication pattern defined.

repos.description: FOLIO Backend Module for cross-app connectivity
repos.name: mod-service-interaction
repos.snippetIntro: Mod-Service-Interaction is a FOLIO Backend Module for cross-app connectivity.

repos.description: Secure global and per-user settings for FOLIO
repos.name: mod-settings
repos.snippetIntro: mod-settings is a key-value store that provides a more secure configuration system than the old mod-configuration.

repos.name: mod-source-record-manager
repos.snippetIntro: FOLIO source record manager module.

repos.description: Persistent source record storage
repos.name: mod-source-record-storage
repos.snippetIntro: FOLIO compatible source record storage module.

repos.description: The blueprint module that could be used as a template for folio spring based backend modules.
repos.name: mod-spring-template
repos.snippetIntro: This is the blueprint module that should be used as a template for FOLIO Spring-based backend modules. It provides the initial configuration and common data schemas used by the FOLIO platform.

repos.description: Central list of tags that can be assigned to various objects
repos.name: mod-tags
repos.snippetIntro: Central list of tags that can be assigned to various objects. Tags are simple strings like 'urgent', or 'important'. These are kept as an array of string values in the various objects that use them. This module provides a centralized repository of allowed values, which can be used for populating pull-down lists etc. The coupling is intentionally rather weak, it will be up to the UI to enforce the use of authorized tags, or not, as each library will want, and/or insert new tags into this module when the user uses a new one.

repos.description: Stores templates and generates files by using them
repos.name: mod-template-engine
repos.snippetIntro: This module is responsible for storing templates and generating text, html, xml, doc, docx etc from the template. Generated payload is described by meta information which contains info about format, size and date. Supports localization of templates.

repos.description: Title-level requests back-end module
repos.name: mod-tlr
repos.snippetIntro: FOLIO compatible title level requests functionality.

repos.description: FOLIO Translations Management API
repos.name: mod-translations
repos.snippetIntro: Each FOLIO installation has lists of controlled vocabulary terms (for instance, “Formats” and “Resource types” in Inventory, “Patron Groups” and “Refund Reasons” in Users — see FOLIO-2802 for a more complete list). In installations that use more than one language, these terms do not display translated values when the locale of the session is changed.

repos.description: Import new or already existing users
repos.name: mod-user-import
repos.snippetIntro: This module is responsible for importing new or already existing users into FOLIO.

repos.description: Domain Model to Manage Users
repos.name: mod-users
repos.snippetIntro: Module to provide central user management for FOLIO systems.

repos.description: Business logic "join" module to provide simple access to all user-centric data
repos.name: mod-users-bl
repos.snippetIntro: Business logic 'join' module to provide simple access to all user-centric data.

repos.name: mod-users-keycloak
repos.snippetIntro: Business logic 'join' module to provide simple access to all user-centric data.

repos.name: mod-workflow
repos.snippetIntro: This module provides a Workflow backend FOLIO module intended to help facilite and interact with one or more Workflow Engines. A Workflow Engine is able to react to events generated in FOLIO and may also trigger events based on some schedule.

repos.description: A Z39.50 server for FOLIO bibliographic data
repos.name: Net-Z3950-FOLIO
repos.snippetIntro: z2folio is a Z39.50 server for FOLIO bibliographic and holdings data, supporting record retrieval in USMARC, OPAC, XML and JSON formats. The functionality is all provided by the Net::Z3950::FOLIO library, which is also part of this distribution. It is written in Perl, and follows standard Perl-module conventions.

repos.description: Okapi core and modules
repos.name: okapi

repos.description: Repository that houses tools and performance testing scripts
repos.name: perf-testing
repos.snippetIntro: Carrier is an open source continuous performance testing toolkit. It consists of tools and practices to integrate non-functional tests into delivery pipeline and organize effective feedback loop.

repos.description: The personal data disclosure form template and related tools/scripts
repos.name: personal-data-disclosure
repos.snippetIntro: The purpose of this repository is to provide a personal data disclosure form template and related tools/scripts. Each module will specialize and store this form in the top level of their git repository. The form is a mechanism to disclose the types of personal data stored by each module. This information enables those hosting FOLIO to better manage and comply with various privacy laws and restrictions, e.g. GDPR, etc.

repos.name: pipelines-shared-library
repos.snippetIntro: The Jenkins Pipelines Shared Library for FOLIO is designed to facilitate and streamline the management of Jenkins pipelines. It provides reusable functions and scripts, aimed at automating CI/CD workflows for the FOLIO platform. This repository includes resources for Jenkins pipeline configurations, Jenkins plugin management, and integration with other components of the FOLIO ecosystem.

repos.description: Complete set of Stripes modules for FOLIO
repos.name: platform-complete
repos.snippetIntro: This is the 'complete' Stripes 'platform'. It consists simply of an NPM package.json that specifies the version of @folio/stripes-core and of any Stripes modules you wish to make available as part of this platform to generate client bundles along with a utility for generating module descriptors for each Stripes module.

repos.description: FOLIO Stripes platform for ERM modules
repos.name: platform-erm
repos.snippetIntro: This is the ERM Stripes 'platform'. It consists simply of an NPM package.json that specifies the version of @folio/stripes-core and of any Stripes modules you wish to make available as part of the ERM platform to generate client bundles along with a utility for generating module descriptors for each Stripes module.

repos.description: Stripes platform for Resource Sharing App
repos.name: platform-rs
repos.snippetIntro: This is the Resource Sharing Stripes 'platform'. It consists simply of an NPM package.json that specifies the version of @folio/stripes and of any Stripes modules you wish to make available as part of the Resource Sharing platform to generate client bundles along with a utility for generating module descriptors for each Stripes module.

repos.description: Simple Python object-oriented interface for getting records from FOLIO
repos.name: pokapi
repos.snippetIntro: The FOLIO platform is a library services platform. The Caltech Library uses a hosted solution by EBSCO for its library catalog. To make writing interfaces and automation scripts in Python easier, the Caltech Library Digital Library Development team are developing Pokapi (Python Okapi Interface), a Python package that provides an object-oriented interface to accessing FOLIO data via the Okapi API. It currently provides a simple object structure based mostly on FOLIO instance records.

repos.description: Repository of RAML files, including JSON schemas, traits and resource types centralized for re-usability
repos.name: raml
repos.snippetIntro: Repository of RAML traits and resource type files.

repos.description: Framework allowing easy module creation based on RAML files
repos.name: raml-module-builder
repos.snippetIntro: This documentation includes information about the Raml-Module-Builder (RMB) framework and examples of how to use it.

repos.description: ERM schema documentation
repos.name: reporting-erm-doc

repos.description: RFCs for changes to the FOLIO platform
repos.name: rfcs

repos.description: Spring module core libraries for Spring development with Okapi
repos.name: spring-module-core
repos.snippetIntro: Spring module core libraries for Spring development with FOLIO.

repos.description: UI framework for building front-end FOLIO modules
repos.name: stripes
repos.snippetIntro: Stripes is a toolkit for building single-page web applications that FOLIO UI modules can run in. In addition to being the home of Stripes framework, this repository serves as a hub for shared Stripes documentation.

repos.description: Stripes components that are specific to use cases that arise in Authority-related modules
repos.name: stripes-authority-components
repos.snippetIntro: This is a library of React components and utility functions for use with the Stripes UI toolkit, part of the FOLIO project.

repos.description: Components to be used by modules and applications that handle Authorization (ui-authorization-roles, ui-authorization-capabilities, etc.) duties. Other modules and applications may not find them as useful.
repos.name: stripes-authorization-components
repos.snippetIntro: This is a library of React components and utility functions for use with the Stripes UI toolkit, part of the FOLIO project.

repos.description: Command line interface for building Stripes UI modules.
repos.name: stripes-build
repos.snippetIntro: stripes-build is a CLI for building Stripes UI platforms. It is nothing more than a stripped down copy of stripes-cli with fewer commands and fewer dependencies, i.e. optimized for generating builds in a production environment.

repos.description: Command line interface for creating, building, and testing Stripes UI modules.
repos.name: stripes-cli
repos.snippetIntro: Stripes CLI is a command line interface to facilitate the creation, development, building, and testing of Stripes UI modules.

repos.description: A Number Generator UI Component
repos.name: stripes-component-number-generator

repos.description: A component library for Stripes
repos.name: stripes-components
repos.snippetIntro: This is a library of React components and utility functions for use with the Stripes UI toolkit, part of the FOLIO project.

repos.description: Declarative REST data access for React components, part of the FOLIO project
repos.name: stripes-connect
repos.snippetIntro: Stripes Connect provides essentially one service: the ability to upgrade a regular React component into a Connected Component. This is done by importing the connect() method from stripes-connect, defining a data manifest, and exporting not the React component itself but the result of wrapping it in a call to connect():

repos.description: The core of Stripes, an opinionated and modular platform for React components consuming REST data and the UI framework for the FOLIO project
repos.name: stripes-core
repos.snippetIntro: Stripes is a toolkit for building single-page web applications that FOLIO UI modules can run in. UI modules are made up of React components, some of which will be connected to back-end services provided by Okapi. Each module has a 'type' which indicates how it functions within the application. At the moment, the only 'type' is 'app' which provides a top-level component to render into a large content area.

repos.description: Stripes components that are specific to use cases that arise in ui-data-import and ui-data-export modules
repos.name: stripes-data-transfer-components
repos.snippetIntro: This is a library of React components and utility functions for use with the Stripes UI toolkit, part of the FOLIO project.

repos.description: Stripes components that are specific to use cases that arise in ERM-related modules

repos.snippetIntro: This is a library of React components and utility functions for use with the Stripes UI toolkit, part of the FOLIO project.

repos.name: stripes-testing
repos.snippetIntro: stripes-testing is a toolkit for building integration tests against Stripes UI modules and platforms. This repository contains:

repos.snippetIntro: Stripes UI is a main wrapper responsible for setting the global layout of the user interface, such as the global navigation menu and top bar. It also renders given stripes module on the appropriate route.

repos.snippetIntro: A library of utility functions to support Stripes modules.

(A 'Stripes UI module' is an NPM module that adheres to certain conventions that allow it to function within the Stripes UI framework that is part of FOLIO.)

repos.name: ui-eholdings
repos.snippetIntro: The ui-eholdings module adds the ability to manage electronic holdings in FOLIO. The first supported knowledge base is from EBSCO.

repos.snippetIntro: The ERM comparisons module, or ui-erm-comparisons, is a Stripes UI module used for comparison of 'Agreement' and/or 'Package' objects defined by the ui-agreements (Agreements) module.

repos.description: Stripes UI for managing ERM usage statistics. Funded by European Regional Development Fund (EFRE).
repos.name: ui-erm-usage
repos.snippetIntro: The ERM-Usage UI Module, or ui-erm-usage, is a Stripes UI module for managing usage statistics. It allows to enter credentials for accessing usage data providers. These credentials are used by the backend module mod-erm-usage to harvest usage statistics periodically.

repos.name: ui-finance
repos.snippetIntro: The ui-finance allows for the management of ledgers, funds, and budgets in FOLIO. It includes a dashboard that provides a snapshot of your account totals for the current fiscal year across ledgers and funds.

repos.description: Reporting Front End module

repos.description: FOLIO front end module for licenses
repos.name: ui-licenses

repos.name: ui-linked-data

repos.name: ui-lists
repos.snippetIntro: The Lists UI Module, or ui-lists, is a Stripes UI Module used to create and manage Lists which are queries across multiple modules (for example: find all items marked as missing or declared lost, or find all open loans assigned to inactive users).

repos.description: UI module for managing organization records

repos.description: FOLIO Translations Management App
repos.name: ui-translations
repos.snippetIntro:
Each FOLIO installation has lists of controlled vocabulary terms (for instance, “Formats” and “Resource types” in Inventory, “Patron Groups” and “Refund Reasons” in Users — see FOLIO-2802 for a more complete list). In installations that use more than one language, these terms do not display translated values when the locale of the session is changed.
So we need a mechanism for translating and managing the translations of the controlled vocabulary terms in the Settings app and all stripes apps that contain controlled vocabularies so that translators can perform the translation work of the controlled vocabulary terms.

repos.description: Update app, part of the UI for the ReShare project
repos.name: ui-update

repos.description: Stripes UI module: administrating users
repos.name: ui-users
repos.snippetIntro: The Users UI Module, or ui-users, is a Stripes UI module used for searching, sorting, filtering, viewing, editing and creating users. (A 'Stripes UI module' is an NPM module that adheres to certain conventions that allow it to function within the Stripes UI framework that is part of FOLIO.)

repos.description: The UI Module for Mod Workflow
repos.name: ui-workflow
repos.snippetIntro: This UI Workflow Module, ui-workflow, is a Stripes UI Module providing a way to build workflows for use in automating processes.

repos.description: Yakbak proxy for reading/writing tapes of network interactions
repos.name: yakbak-proxy
repos.snippetIntro: yakbak-proxy is a simple Web proxy implemented using yakbak. It accepts incoming HTTP connections and proxies them through the nominated server, keeping a record ('tapes') of all requests and their corresponding responses. Then later you can run the same client against the same proxy server, and it will re-use the tapes. This is especially useful for testing a Web UI away from its corresponding back-end.
